description: SVG-Powered component to easily create placeholder loadings (like Facebook cards loading)

hooks.pre-commit: npm run lint && npm run format

name: react-content-loader
readme: SVG-PoweredÂ componentÂ toÂ easilyÂ createÂ placeholderÂ loadingsÂ (likeÂ Facebook'sÂ cardsÂ loading). ## Features - :gear:Â **Customizable:**Â FeelÂ freeÂ toÂ changeÂ theÂ colors,Â speed,Â sizesÂ andÂ evenÂ **RTL**; - :ok_hand:Â **PlugÂ andÂ play:**Â withÂ manyÂ presetsÂ toÂ use,Â seeÂ theÂ [examples](http://danilowoz.com/create-content-loader/#gallery); - :pencil2:Â **DIY:**Â useÂ theÂ [create-content-loader](https://danilowoz.github.io/create-content-loader/)Â toÂ createÂ yourÂ ownÂ customÂ loadersÂ easily; - ğŸ“± **React Native support**: same API, as same powerful features; - âš›ï¸ **Really lightweight:** less than **2kB** and **0 dependencies** for web version; ## Index - [GettingÂ Started](#gettingstarted) - [Usage](#usage) - [Native](#native) - [Options](#options) - [Examples](#examples) - [SimilarÂ packages](#similarpackages) - [Development](#development) - [KnownÂ Issues](#knownissues) ## GettingÂ Started ```sh npm i react-content-loader --save ``` ```sh yarn add react-content-loader ``` CDNÂ fromÂ [JSDELIVR](https://www.jsdelivr.com/package/npm/react-content-loader) ## Usage ThereÂ areÂ twoÂ waysÂ toÂ useÂ it: **1.Â Presets,Â seeÂ theÂ [examples](#examples):** ```jsx import ContentLoader, { Facebook } from 'react-content-loader' const MyLoader = () => const MyFacebookLoader = () => ``` **2.Â CustomÂ mode,Â seeÂ theÂ [onlineÂ tool](https://danilowoz.github.io/create-react-content-loader/)** ```jsx const MyLoader = () => ( {/*Â OnlyÂ SVGÂ shapesÂ */}Â Â Â Â  ) ``` **Still not clear?** Take a look at this working example at [codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/moojk887z9) Or try the components editable demo hands-on and install it from [bit.dev](https://bit.dev/danilowoz/react-content-loader) ## Native `react-content-loader` can be used with React Native in the same way as web version with the same import: **1.Â Presets,Â seeÂ theÂ [examples](#examples):** ```jsx import ContentLoader, { Facebook } from 'react-content-loader/native' const MyLoader = () => const MyFacebookLoader = () => ``` **2.Â CustomÂ mode** **To create custom loaders there is an important difference:** as React Native doesn't have any native module for SVG components, it's necessary to import the shapes from [react-native-svg](https://github.com/react-native-community/react-native-svg) or use the named export Rect and Circle from `react-content-loader` import: ```jsx import ContentLoader, { Rect, Circle } from 'react-content-loader/native' const MyLoader = () => ( ) ``` ## Options #### **`animate?: boolean`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `true`.Â Opt-outÂ ofÂ animationsÂ withÂ `false` #### **`ariaLabel? string | boolean`** - _Web only_ DefaultsÂ toÂ `Loading interface...`.Â It'sÂ usedÂ toÂ describeÂ whatÂ elementÂ itÂ is.Â UseÂ `false`Â toÂ remove. #### **`baseUrl? string`** - _Web only_ RequiredÂ ifÂ you'reÂ usingÂ `` documentÂ ``.Â  DefaultsÂ toÂ anÂ emptyÂ string.Â ThisÂ propÂ isÂ commonÂ usedÂ as:Â ``Â whichÂ willÂ fillÂ theÂ SVGÂ attributeÂ withÂ theÂ relativeÂ path.Â RelatedÂ [#93](https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/issues/93). #### **`speed?: number`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `2`.Â AnimationÂ speedÂ inÂ seconds. #### **`interval?: number`** - _Web only_ DefaultsÂ toÂ `0.25`.Â IntervalÂ ofÂ timeÂ betweenÂ runsÂ ofÂ theÂ animation,Â asÂ aÂ fractionÂ ofÂ theÂ animationÂ speed. #### **`className? string`** DefaultsÂ toÂ anÂ emptyÂ string.Â TheÂ classnameÂ willÂ beÂ setÂ inÂ theÂ ``Â element. #### **`width? number`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `400`.Â ItÂ willÂ beÂ setÂ inÂ theÂ viewboxÂ attrÂ inÂ theÂ ``. #### **`height? number`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `130`.Â ItÂ willÂ beÂ setÂ inÂ theÂ viewboxÂ attrÂ inÂ theÂ ``. #### **`gradientRatio? number`** - _Web only_ DefaultsÂ toÂ `2`.Â WidthÂ ofÂ theÂ animatedÂ gradientÂ asÂ aÂ fractionÂ ofÂ theÂ viewboxÂ width. #### **`rtl? boolean`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `false`.Â ContentÂ right-to-left. #### **`preserveAspectRatio?: string`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `xMidYMid meet`.Â AspectÂ ratioÂ optionÂ ofÂ ``.Â SeeÂ theÂ availableÂ optionsÂ [here](https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/src/interface.ts#L7). #### **`primaryColor?: string`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `#f3f3f3`Â whichÂ isÂ usedÂ asÂ backgroundÂ ofÂ animation. #### **`secondaryColor?: string`** DefaultsÂ toÂ `#ecebeb`Â whichÂ isÂ usedÂ asÂ theÂ placeholder/layerÂ ofÂ animation. #### **`primaryOpacity?: string`** - _Web only_ DefaultsÂ toÂ `1`.Â BackgroundÂ opacityÂ (0Â =Â transparent,Â 1Â =Â opaque)Â usedÂ toÂ solveÂ aÂ issueÂ inÂ [Safari](#safari--ios) #### **`secondaryOpacity?: string`** - _Web only_ DefaultsÂ toÂ `1`.Â AnimationÂ opacityÂ (0Â =Â transparent,Â 1Â =Â opaque)Â usedÂ toÂ solveÂ aÂ issueÂ inÂ [Safari](#safari--ios) #### **`style?: React.CSSProperties`** DefaultsÂ toÂ anÂ emptyÂ object. #### **`uniquekey?: string`** - _Web only_ DefaultsÂ toÂ randomÂ uniqueÂ id.Â UseÂ theÂ sameÂ valueÂ ofÂ propÂ key,Â thatÂ willÂ solveÂ inconsistencyÂ onÂ theÂ SSR,Â seeÂ moreÂ [here](https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/issues/78). ## Examples ##### FacebookÂ Style ```jsx import { Facebook } from 'react-content-loader' const MyFacebookLoader = () => ``` ![FacebookÂ Style](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4838076/34308760-ec55df82-e735-11e7-843b-2e311fa7b7d0.gif) ##### InstagramÂ Style ```jsx import { Instagram } from 'react-content-loader' const MyInstagramLoader = () => ``` ![InstagramÂ Style](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4838076/22555637/749f9e26-e94b-11e6-84ff-83cd415c1eb9.gif) ##### CodeÂ Style ```jsx import { Code } from 'react-content-loader' const MyCodeLoader = () => ``` ![CodeÂ Style](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4838076/22555473/effa54c2-e94a-11e6-9128-9b608bcc69d9.gif) ##### ListÂ Style ```jsx import { List } from 'react-content-loader' const MyListLoader = () => ``` ![ListÂ Style](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4838076/36352948-b8931430-149e-11e8-9f4b-3f00bc444a6d.gif) ##### BulletÂ listÂ Style ```jsx import { BulletList } from 'react-content-loader' const MyBulletListLoader = () => ``` ![BulletÂ listÂ Style](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4838076/31998372-59817bac-b96e-11e7-8ef8-07f61670ee18.gif) ### CustomÂ Style ForÂ theÂ customÂ mode,Â useÂ the [onlineÂ tool](https://danilowoz.github.io/create-react-content-loader/). ```jsx const MyLoader = () => ( Â Â Â Â {/*Â OnlyÂ SVGÂ shapesÂ */} Â Â Â Â  Â Â Â Â  Â Â Â Â  Â Â  ) ``` --- ![Custom](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4838076/36352947-b87019a8-149e-11e8-99ba-c71c2bcf8733.gif) ## SimilarÂ packages - ReactÂ Native:Â [rn-placeholder](https://github.com/mfrachet/rn-placeholder),Â [react-native-svg-animated-linear-gradient](https://github.com/virusvn/react-native-svg-animated-linear-gradient); - [Preact](https://github.com/bonitasoft/preact-content-loader); - Vue.js:Â [vue-content-loading](https://github.com/LucasLeandro1204/vue-content-loading),Â [vue-content-loader](https://github.com/egoist/vue-content-loader); - Angular:Â [ngx-content-loading](https://github.com/Gbuomprisco/ngx-content-loading),Â [ngx-content-loader](https://github.com/NetanelBasal/ngx-content-loader). ## Development ForkÂ theÂ repoÂ thenÂ cloneÂ it ``` $Â gitÂ cloneÂ git@github.com:YourUsername/react-content-loader.gitÂ &&Â cdÂ react-content-loader ``` `$ npm i`:Â InstallÂ theÂ dependencies; `$ npm run build`:Â BuildÂ toÂ production; `$ npm run dev`:Â RunÂ theÂ doczÂ toÂ seeÂ yourÂ changes; `$ npm run test`:Â RunÂ allÂ tests:Â typeÂ checking,Â unitÂ tests on web and native; `$ yarn test:watch`:Â WatchÂ unitÂ tests; `$ yarn tsc`:Â TypescriptÂ checking; `$ yarn tsc:watch`:Â TypescriptÂ checkingÂ withÂ watching; ### CommitÂ messages CommitÂ messagesÂ shouldÂ followÂ theÂ [commitÂ messageÂ convention](https://conventionalcommits.org/)Â so,Â changelogsÂ couldÂ beÂ generatedÂ automaticallyÂ byÂ that.Â CommitÂ messagesÂ areÂ validatedÂ automaticallyÂ uponÂ commit.Â IfÂ youÂ aren'tÂ familiarÂ withÂ theÂ commitÂ messageÂ convention,Â youÂ canÂ useÂ yarnÂ commitÂ (orÂ `npm run commit`)Â insteadÂ ofÂ gitÂ commit,Â whichÂ providesÂ anÂ interactiveÂ CLIÂ forÂ generatingÂ properÂ commitÂ messages. ## License [MIT](https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/blob/master/LICENSE) ## KnownÂ Issues ##### **AlphaÂ isÂ notÂ working:Â SafariÂ /Â iOS** WhenÂ usingÂ `rgba`Â asÂ aÂ `primaryColor`Â orÂ `secondaryColor`Â value,Â [SafariÂ doesÂ notÂ respectÂ theÂ alphaÂ channel](https://github.com/w3c/svgwg/issues/180),Â meaningÂ thatÂ theÂ colorÂ willÂ beÂ opaque.Â ToÂ preventÂ this,Â insteadÂ ofÂ usingÂ anÂ `rgba`Â valueÂ forÂ `primaryColor`/`secondaryColor`,Â useÂ theÂ `rgb`Â equivalentÂ andÂ moveÂ theÂ alphaÂ channelÂ valueÂ toÂ theÂ `primaryOpacity`/`secondaryOpacity`Â props. ```jsx {/*Â OpaqueÂ colorÂ inÂ SafariÂ andÂ iOSÂ */} {/_Â Semi-transparentÂ colorÂ inÂ SafariÂ andÂ iOSÂ _/} ``` ##### **BlackÂ boxÂ inÂ SafariÂ /Â iOSÂ (again)** UsingÂ baseÂ tagÂ onÂ aÂ pageÂ thatÂ containsÂ SVGÂ elementsÂ failsÂ toÂ renderÂ andÂ itÂ looksÂ likeÂ aÂ blackÂ box.Â JustÂ removeÂ theÂ **base-href**Â tagÂ fromÂ theÂ ``Â andÂ issueÂ solved. See:Â [#93](https://github.com/danilowoz/react-content-loader/issues/93)Â /Â [109](
